alert.note: Alert for Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 3:19PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hot Springs County through 345 PM MDT... At 318 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Thermopolis, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Thermopolis and Hot Springs State Park around 330 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Lucerne and Kirby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin
